intro: Alternanthera latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf Alternanthera, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage that ranges from red to purple and pink, depending on light exposure. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 24 inches and features small, inconspicuous white flowers. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and containers.
